results.title: The Renaissance Women Who Painted Against the Odds
results.abstract: The Wadsworth Atheneum spotlights female artists from Italy in the 16th through 18th centuries, and asks: Who got left out of the canon?

media.caption: Artemisia Gentileschi, with “Self-Portrait as a Lute Player,” c. 1615–18, and other paintings, headlines a show of women of the Italian Renaissance and Baroque at the Wadsworth Atheneum.

results.adx_keywords: Art;Slavery (Historical);Native Americans;Navajo Indians;Museums;Thomas, Chip (Photographer);Fort Garland Museum & Cultural Center;Colorado
results.title: A Grim, Long-Hidden Truth Emerges in Art: Native American Enslavement
results.abstract: Two exhibitions highlight stories of Indigenous bondage in southern Colorado, in an effort to grapple with the lasting trauma.

media.caption: Chip Thomas, a physician on the Navajo Nation, is also an artist who created two installations, about 50 miles apart, based on an 1865 census of enslaved Native people in Conejos County and Costilla County, Colo. Here, a partial listing of their names on a wall of a slave dwelling at the compound of Lafayette Head, who took the survey.
media.copyright: Kalen Goodluck for The New York Times

results.title: Pfizer’s Covid Pill Works Well, Company Confirms in Final Analysis
results.abstract: The treatment, called Paxlovid, is likely to work against Omicron and could be available in the United States before the end of the year.

results.title: When the Show Doesn’t Go On: Broadway Is Rattled by Covid Cancellations
results.abstract: Broadway, where cancellations were once vanishingly rare, has seen a raft of them as positive coronavirus tests among cast and crew members have upended productions.

media.caption: A growing number of Broadway shows have had to cancel performances because of the coronavirus, including “Ain’t Too Proud,” where some patrons arrived Tuesday only to find out that night’s performance had been canceled.

results.title: Green-Energy Race Draws an American Underdog to Bolivia’s Lithium
results.abstract: Chinese and Russian industrial giants seek to tap mineral deposits vital to electric cars. A Texas entrepreneur has his own strategy: the long game.
